paper_title.en: Study of Magnetic Properties and Ion size Effect for (La<sub>1-x</sub>Y<sub>x</sub>)<sub>2/3</sub>Ca<sub>1/3</sub>MnO<sub>3</sub>(0≦x≦0.3) Manganese

publication_name.en: Chinese Journal of Low Temperature Physics

paper_title.en: Thermal conductivity study on the borocarbide superconductor LuNi2B2C under applied magnetic fields

description.en: Applied magnetic field dependence of thermal conductivity (TC) and the temperature dependences of resistivity and magnetization on the nickel borocarbide superconducting compound LuNi2B2C have been measured in the temperature range from 4.2 to 30 K, under the applied magnetic field range of 0-8 T. The magnetic field dependence of the TC showed characteristic behavior at the lower and the upper critical fields at temperatures below T,. We present the first temperature dependence curve of upper critical field derived from the results of TC measurement of LuNi2B2C. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Thermal conductivity study on the borocarbide superconductor LuNi2B2C under applied magnetic fields

description.en: Applied magnetic field dependence of thermal conductivity (TC) and the temperature dependences of resistivity and magnetization on the nickel borocarbide superconducting compound LuNi2B2C have been measured in the temperature range from 4.2 to 30 K, under the applied magnetic field range of 0-8 T. The magnetic field dependence of the TC showed characteristic behavior at the lower and the upper critical fields at temperatures below T,. We present the first temperature dependence curve of upper critical field derived from the results of TC measurement of LuNi2B2C. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Effect of grain Boundaries on Thermal conductivity of Silicon Carbide ceramic at 5 to 1300K
Magnetic and superconducting properities of R<sub>1-x</sub> Nd<sub>x</sub> Ni<sub>2</sub>B<sub>2</sub>C (R=Y and Er) systems

paper_title.en: Effect of grain Boundaries on Thermal conductivity of Silicon Carbide ceramic at 5 to 1300K
Magnetic and superconducting properities of R<sub>1-x</sub> Nd<sub>x</sub> Ni<sub>2</sub>B<sub>2</sub>C (R=Y and Er) systems
Therma conductivity of RNi<sub>2</sub>B<sub>2</sub>C(R=Gd, Dy, Ho, Er, Tm and Lu)systems

description.en: The variations of the superconducting transition temperature T-c and the magnetic transition temperature T-N as functions of the Dy concentration x in the pseudo-quaternary system Er1-xDyxNi2B2C have been systematically investigated by the measurements of electrical resistivity, magnetization, and specific heat. A second magnetic phase transition T-m was observed for the compounds with x=0.29, 0.30, and 0.31, with a concomitant suppression of T-c. A similar second magnetic phase transition T-m and suppression of T-c were also observed for the compounds with x=0.6, 0.7, and 0.8. These results provided the (T-c,T-N)-x phase diagram of Er1-xDyxNi2B2C system.

paper_title.en: Thermal conductivity of RNi2B2C (R=Er, Tm, and Gd) systems

description.en: The temperature dependences of thermal conductivity have been measured for RNi2B2C (R=Er, Tm, and Gd) systems under various applied magnetic fields. The temperature dependences of thermal conductivity of RNi2B2C (R=Er and Tm) showed a change in slope at T-c. In zero magnetic field, the thermal conductivity of ErNi2B2C and GdNi2B2C showed small peaks at T-N, which disappeared under applied magnetic fields. At temperatures below T-c, the value of thermal conductivity in an applied magnetic field was larger than that in zero field.

paper_title.en: Thermoelectric power measurement at low temperatures down to 0.25 K

description.en: We have developed an experimental setup for measuring thermoelectric power (TEP) from 5 to 0.25 K using a He-3-He-4 dilution refrigerator. A good function of this setup was proved by measuring TEP of a superconductor LaPdSn and an antiferromagnetic Kondo compound CePdSn whose data for T > 2 K are available. The existence of a new positive peak of TEP around 2 K for CePdSn was ascertained. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Low temperature specific heat of Zr<sub>2</sub>(Cu<sub>1-x</sub>Ni<sub>x</sub>) under magnetic
Correlation between superconducting and magnetic transition temperatures of R1-xNdxNi2B2C (R=Y, Ho, Er)

description.en: The variations of the superconducting transition temperature T-c and the magnetic transition temperature TN as a function of the Nd concentration x in R1-xNdxNi2B2C (R=Y, Ho, and Er) systems is systematically studied by the measurements of electrical resistivity and magnetization. It is found that the Nd substitution in R1-xNdxNi2B2C show an effect to break: Cooper pairs. The de Gennes scaling on the variation of T-c as also discussed.

paper_title.en: Thermal conductivity of Y2O3-doped Si3N4 ceramic at 4 to 1000 K

description.en: In order to study the reentrant behavior in HoNi2B2C compound, the variation of the superconducting transition temperature T-c, against the Nd substitution concentration x in polycrystalline samples of Ho1-xNdxNi2B2C was systematically investigated by the measurements of electrical resistivity in the temperature range from 2 K to 20 K. The Nd substitution for Ho showed the similar effect to break Cooper-pairs as an applied magnetic field. The pair breaking near T-m, which indicates the incommensurate magnetic ordering temperature of HoNi2B2C compound, is strong enough to suppress superconductivity, resulting in two distinct superconducting regions above and below T-m in the T-x phase diagram. The variation of T-c against Nd concentration x: showed the breakdown of de Gennes scaling. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

In order to study the reentrant behavior in HoNi2B2C compound, the variation of the superconducting transition temperature T-c, against the Nd substitution concentration x in polycrystalline samples of Ho1-xNdxNi2B2C was systematically investigated by the measurements of electrical resistivity in the temperature range from 2 K to 20 K. The Nd substitution for Ho showed the similar effect to break Cooper-pairs as an applied magnetic field. The pair breaking near T-m, which indicates the incommensurate magnetic ordering temperature of HoNi2B2C compound, is strong enough to suppress superconductivity, resulting in two distinct superconducting regions above and below T-m in the T-x phase diagram. The variation of T-c against Nd concentration x: showed the breakdown of de Gennes scaling. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Magnetic and thermal properties of RAu2Ge2

description.en: Experimental studies of magnetization and specific heat for the RAu2Ge2 (R = Pr, Nd and Sm) compounds are reported. The measurements revealed that the compounds ordered antiferromagnetically at 12, 4.5 and 12 K for R = Pr, Nd and Sm, respectively. The magnetization curves of PrAu2Ge2 and NdAu2Ge2 showed metamagnetic processes. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Thermal conductivity of intermetallic compound NdNi

description.en: The temperature dependence of thermal conductivity and electrical resistivity was measured for the polycrystalline ferromagnetic compound NdNi and nonmagnetic LaNi in the temperature region from 2 to 40 K. Anomalies were observed in the temperature dependence of thermal conductivity, electrical resistivity and Lorenz number of NdNi at 14 and 27 K due to the magnetic scattering process. Assuming the validity of the Wiedemann-Franz law, we have tried to separate the electron and phonon components of thermal conductivity of nonmagnetic compound LaNi. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
